techmeme.title: TrendForce: TSMC's global foundry revenue share will hit 64% in 2024, up from 51% in 2019, while Samsung's share is set to drop to 10%, down from 16% in 2019 (Jiyoung Sohn/Wall Street Journal)
Uber announces ride-hailing and delivery updates: an EV-only Uber Green in 40 cities, a GPT-4o-powered chatbot to answer drivers' EV questions, and more (Andrew J. Hawkins/The Verge)
The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences awards the Nobel Prize in Physics to John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton for "foundational discoveries" in machine learning (Kati Pohjanpalo/Bloomberg)
Israel compromising Hezbollah pagers shows the West should take hardware security more seriously, especially as most electronics manufacturing shifted to Asia (Chris Miller/Financial Times)
Filing: Saudi Arabia's PIF sold ~17.3M Nintendo shares between August 21 to October 1, lowering its stake to 7.54%, despite an exec saying it wants to buy more (Bloomberg)
